page.title: 10CHURCHES IN PENDLESIDE
page.content: There are three{churches}in the area.: {St Marys (parish)}Newchurch,{Methodist Barley,{Inghamite}WheatleyLane.{Ingham {ite}movement was founded in Yorkshire in 1740. Wheatley Church(capacity 250) built in 1750,was the 2nd.inLancashire and is the only one with a full-time minister, of the 3 which remain. There are{45-50 regular worshippers of all {ages.}It is a popular place for wedd- ings for people who do not regularly attend.There is a{flourishing Sunday {School}and several mid-week meetings and activities,including"Supersplash" sessions at Nelson Baths each week. There are comfortably furnished meet- ing rooms & kitchen etc.as well as the main Sanctuary.There is a large {Burial ground}with over 100,000 bodies interred,but not many recently as the trend is to cremation with ashes in niches in a{Garden of Remembrance.
